{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3487463,"name":"Emil","username":"GronkBaby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-19T16:01:28.132Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone.
I tried reflashing my Limelight 3 to the 2025 Limelight OS version, and I can only access it through limelight.local:5801 when I connect to it using usb-c. However, when I disconnect (I’m connected to the robot via radio), limelight.local:5801, and its old name, limelight-three.local:5801, before it was reflashed don’t work.

I also noticed that when connected through usb-c in the settings of limelight.local:5801, it shows that the IP-address defaulted to static and needs to be set. But when I set it to what I’m supposed to set it to, or try changing to dynamic, and press the change IP settings button and power-cycle, there’s no change.

Any guidance would be appreciated

We are having a similar issue with our limelight 2+. We can connect directly with an ethernet connection to our laptop, but not through the radio. We seem unable to change to either a dynamic IP or to the correct static ip. Though we are able to change the team number.
We tried using older version of the firmware as a test, but have not seen an improvement.

FYI. We just replaced our om5 radios with the new vh109 system and we seem to be back up and running. We are currently using dynamic IP address and haven’t tried static.
